items.title: Karnivool's new album In Verses was worth the 13-year wait, bagpipes and all
items.summary: They're one of Australia's most revered heavy acts. And arguably the most patient. Karnivool unpack the 13-year journey to their new album, In Verses.

items.title: ATO debt continues to drive record level of calls to small business financial helpline
items.summary: Financial counsellors say small businesses struggling to pay debts owed to the tax office are driving calls to Australia's Small Business Debt Helpline higher.

items.title: What Israel's President Isaac Herzog has said about Gaza, and why he won't be arrested in Australia
items.summary: When Israel's president lands in Australia this weekend, he can expect an official red carpet treatment. But he will be all too aware of the controversy his visit is generating.

items.title: US hopes to challenge China's critical minerals dominance with new trading bloc
items.summary: The US is urging dozens of countries to follow Australia's lead and sign on to a plan to stop relying on China for the critical minerals used in modern technology.

items.title: An ex-jihadi and terror experts agree on one thing about extremism
items.summary: As police probe what led to the deadliest terror attack on Australian soil in December, radicalisation researchers and a former Islamic State group supporter have shed light on how people are recruited.

items.title: Winter Olympics 2026: When does it start, how to watch and who is competing in which sports
items.summary: Australia is tipped for enormous success over the next couple of weeks so now might be a good time to clue yourself up. Here's everything you need to know about the 2026 Winter Games.

items.title: Effect of capital gains tax changes on housing affordability likely depends on design
items.summary: Labor has not ruled out changes to the capital gains tax discount but wants any tax changes to improve housing affordability.

items.title: Former attorney-general Mark Dreyfus warned anti-corruption chief to 'manage' or 'avoid' conflicts
items.summary: A letter from Mark Dreyfus to Paul Brereton provides new insight into the expectations set for the inaugural chief of the anti-corruption watchdog.

items.title: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese signs security treaty with Indonesia
items.summary: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has travelled to Jakarta to sign the treaty, which the Australian government calls the "biggest step" the countries have taken together in 30 years.

items.title: Today in history, February 6: The Manchester United team that perished in the Munich air disaster of 1958
items.summary: On a snowy February afternoon in 1958, the football team that many were calling the greatest that Britain had ever produced stopped to refuel at Munich Airport. The plane would never take off, and the Flowers of Manchester would take years to bloom again.

items.title: Epstein files reveal the men who looked away after women had spoken up
items.summary: The millions of pages of documents related to the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein have shone a light on how many influential men were ready to disregard the experiences of countless women.

items.title: Valentino Guseli gets snowboard big air wildcard, leaps into final at Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics
items.summary: Valentino Guseli only found out he had been added to the big air field a couple of hours before the competition start after a rival's injury, but still found a way to make it to the final.

items.title: New study reveals how stressful footy fandom can be
items.summary: A new study reveals how much high-stakes sporting events can get the heart pumping by strapping trackers to over 200 German football fans.

items.title: Diamonds defeat Jamaica in first netball Test match in Adelaide
items.summary: The Diamonds made a flying start with the initial six goals in a comprehensive 72-41 victory at the Adelaide Entertainment Centre.

items.title: Bondi Junction inquest saw recommendation for supported housing for homeless, some are already benefitting
items.summary: An inquest into the Bondi Junction stabbing has recommended that the NSW government support long-term accommodation for homeless people experiencing mental health issues. It's a model that is already finding success.

items.title: Victoria and Queensland lose 17 wickets on day one of MCG Sheffield Shield game
items.summary: After the two-day Ashes Test raised eyebrows over the MCG pitch, Queensland and Victoria are on track for another swift finish after 17 wickets on day one of their Sheffield Shield clash.

items.title: Nationals issue Ley with reunion counteroffer as deadline looms
items.summary: The minor party has given the opposition leader terms that one Nationals MP said they did "not expect" would be acceptable in what has been described as a bid to push out her self-imposed deadline.

items.title: Thursday Finance with David Chau
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Coroner recommends Ambulance Victoria guideline review following nut allergy death of Max McKenzie
items.summary: The coroner could not definitively rule that the anaphylaxis death of 15-year-old Max McKenzie was preventable, despite identifying delays in the teen's medical treatment.

items.title: Man convicted of grooming one girl and raping another at Canberra Reptile Zoo
items.summary: A 26-year-old man has been convicted in the ACT Supreme Court of sexually assaulting two girls at Canberra Reptile Zoo.

items.title: Union urges Sanjeev Gupta to sell Tahmoor mine as $350m offer revealed
items.summary: The Mining and Energy Union says a firm $350 million offer is on the table to restart Tahmoor Colliery, warning delays risk the mine's future and hundreds of jobs.

items.title: How capital gains tax changes could impact you
items.summary: According to a well-sourced leak, changes to capital gains tax discounts could form the centrepiece of the next federal budget in May. And while the government has downplayed the idea, it has not been ruled out.

items.title: Democrat victory in Republican stronghold could spell trouble for Trump
items.summary: The US has been gripped by cold weather in recent weeks, but pundits say it is in Texas where hell has truly frozen over. A blue wave just swept a GOP stronghold, and Republicans are very worried.

items.title: Today show host Savannah Guthrie asks for proof her mother is alive in social media video
items.summary: The Today show host releases a video on Instagram asking for proof her mother is still alive.

items.title: Albanese, Ley condemn alleged act of terror targeting Indigenous protesters
items.summary: The prime minister and opposition leader have both condemned the alleged attempted bombing of an Invasion Day rally more than a week ago, after police revealed it was being prosecuted as a terror incident.

items.title: NSW government contacts Newcastle Writers Festival about author Randa Abdel-Fattah's inclusion
items.summary: The NSW government makes contact with the board of next month's Newcastle Writers Festival about the inclusion of Palestinian-Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah, the ABC understands.

items.title: Melbourne public housing tower residents win injunction against eviction notices ahead of High Court bid
items.summary: Homes Victoria will be temporarily halted from evicting remaining residents at three Melbourne public housing towers in Flemington and North Melbourne, after an injunction was issued in Victoria's Court of Appeal.

items.title: Lockhart River Mayor Wayne William Butcher pleads guilty to Cairns bail breach
items.summary: A Far North Queensland mayor has pleaded guilty to two counts of breaching his bail conditions after he was found drinking tea in a casino with a person he must avoid.

items.title: Mother of autistic children shares experience in wake of suspected double murder-suicide
items.summary: A mother of two autistic children living in regional Western Australia has shared her experience of navigating bureaucracy while caring for children with complex needs.

items.title: Andrew Hastie reads Art of War, Pauline Hanson returns
items.summary: The calamity unfolding in the dissolved Coalition provided a convenient distraction for the government, which should have had a worse week amid an interest rate hike.

items.title: Families respond after Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing inquest findings released
items.summary: Loved ones of victims Ashlee Good and Jade Young have fought back tears responding to findings from the high-profile inquest into the Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing.

items.title: ACTU pushing 'above-inflation' wage increase in 2026 as real paypackets decline
items.summary: Australia's biggest employers are under pressure to give their workers pay increases above 4 per cent this year, as real wages go backwards and the union movement ramps up pressure.

items.title: AFL integrity unit looking into why police visited Melbourne Demons player Steven May
items.summary: Melbourne veteran Steven May is being investigated by the AFL integrity unit, as the premiership defender stays away from Demons training.

items.title: Private health insurers take aim at rising specialists fees
items.summary: A survey of 4,000 patients finds more than half had an unexpected cost when under a specialist's care.

items.title: Strict caps on bottled water extraction urged for World Heritage-listed Springbrook
items.summary: A long-awaited study warns that the extraction of bottled water from the World Heritage-listed Springbrook area poses a potential risk to the ancient Gondwana rainforests and should be strictly limited.

items.title: Union calls for urgent response after Ashley Youth Detention Centre staff hospitalised
items.summary: A union claims management at Tasmania's youth prison did not follow its own short-staffing policy, despite an incident occurring only a day after workers took strike action due to safety concerns.

items.title: Invasion Day bomb declared terror act, as accused's 'pro-white ideology' probed
items.summary: The attempted bombing of an Invasion Day rally in Perth's CBD last week is declared a terrorist attack by authorities.

items.title: Gus disappearance declared major crime, suspect identified
items.summary: South Australian police have declared the disappearance of Gus Lamont a major crime and say a person who has lived at his outback property is now considered a suspect, but have stressed that the boy's parents are not under investigation.

items.title: State of Origin 2027 in New Zealand hailed as a boost for rugby league by Kiwi great
items.summary: The NRL's reported landmark move to host a State of Origin match in New Zealand is hailed as "sensational" by Kiwi legend Gary Freeman.

items.title: New resource connects people with organisations on front lines of bushfire relief effort
items.summary: A new online resource aims to make it easier for people to contribute to bushfire relief efforts across Victoria.

items.title: Donald Trump, gold, interest rates and AI data centres to dominate company reporting season
items.summary: Australia's mining sector is expected to lead the earnings charge for this reporting season, boosted by signs of a stabilisation in the Chinese economy and a turbo-charged commodities market.

items.title: Welfare concerns for missing man Luke Hazelwood last seen outside of Lancelin Sands Hotel
items.summary: Luke Hazelwood was last seen outside the Lancelin Sands Hotel on December 24, but his family are holding out hope for his safe return.

items.title: What are data centres and what do they mean for regional Victoria?
items.summary: With the announcement of two new facilities outside of Melbourne, could regional Victoria become a hotspot for data centres?

items.title: Two months since the social media ban began and teens say it isn't working
items.summary: Australia's world-first social media ban for under-16s is two months old, but teenagers say they have found ways around it.

items.title: Parramatta Eels veteran Josh Addo-Carr urges young teammates to step up after Zac Lomax depature
items.summary: Parramatta's next generation of outside backs must step up if they are to fill the void left by Zac Lomax, his ex-teammate Josh Addo-Carr has said.

items.title: Mother shares concerns about treatment at Toowoomba Hospital amid culture review
items.summary: A confrontation caught on body-worn security footage in the halls of the Toowoomba Hospital maternity unit highlights concerns raised by local mothers.

items.title: Grandmother removed from Toowoomba birth suite by security
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: Fears SA's endangered glossy black-cockatoo eggs will 'cook' in nesting boxes during heatwave
items.summary: South Australia's population of a unique subspecies of glossy black-cockatoos is heavily dependent on artificial nesting boxes. That could pose a problem during extreme heat conditions.

items.title: Report calls for Australia to grow security, trade and diplomatic ties with Taiwan because of China's influence
items.summary: Experts say Australia needs to do more to grow its relationship with Taiwan as China works to diplomatically isolate Taipei in the region.

items.title: In Zak Hilditch's horror movie We Bury the Dead, the zombie apocalypse devastates Tasmania
items.summary: These Final Hours writer and director Zak Hilditch drew on personal tragedy to produce We Bury the Dead, his biggest cinematic epic yet.

items.title: Report points to exploitation, Medicare and visa concerns in Pacific islander jobs scheme
items.summary: Changing jobs is a basic right for most people, but it is not so simple for Pacific Australia Labour Mobility workers.

items.title: Online safety watchdog says tech giants failing to detect child abuse
items.summary: Major tech companies including Apple, Google, Meta and Microsoft are still failing to do enough to detect and stop child sexual abuse, eSafety has claimed.

items.title: Attorney-General asked anti-corruption chief to explain himself after Defence ties emerged
items.summary: Attorney-General Michelle Rowland asked Paul Brereton to explain why his ongoing ties to Defence had not been "adequately" disclosed in a letter sent last year.

items.title: 'Bloodbath' at Washington Post as massive layoffs announced
items.summary: The Jeff Bezos-owned paper, which famously brought down US President Richard Nixon, will drastically cut back in size and lay off workers in all its departments.

items.title: Winter Olympics quiz: How well are you prepared for the Games?
items.summary: The Winter Olympics gets underway in Milan Cortina this week — but how much do you know about the Winter Olympics? Test yourself in our fiendish quiz.

items.title: Trump administration pulls 700 immigration officers out of Minnesota
items.summary: The administration's border tsar says the decision came after local and state authorities agreed to cooperate more closely with its immigration crackdown.

items.title: At least 162 dead, local king missing after gunmen storm Nigerian village
items.summary: Government authorities are blaming "terrorist cells" for the violence in Africa's most populous country.

items.title: Capital gains tax reform among options as Labor weighs housing pitch
items.summary: After Jim Chalmers repeatedly refused to rule out changing the capital gains tax discount, a government source told the ABC that changes related to housing were being considered, with capital gains not ruled out.

items.title: Australia announces Jakara Anthony, Matt Graham as 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics flag bearers
items.summary: Jakara Anthony and Matt Graham have been named as flag bearers for the 2026 Winter Olympic Games in Milano Cortina.

items.title: Bill Gates denies allegations in new Epstein files release
items.summary: Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates denies ever visiting Jeffrey Epstein's private island after new claims surfaced following the release of files from a US government investigation into the late sex offender.

items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Second inquest wraps up into the disappearance of escort Revelle Balmain at Kingsford in 1994
items.summary: An inquest has wrapped up into the disappearance of Sydney escort Revelle Balmain, 31 years after she was reported missing.

items.title: K'gari traditional owners hold smoking ceremony for Piper James on beach where she died
items.summary: K'gari traditional owners have held a smoking ceremony for Piper James, who died on the island last month, to give her spirit a safe passage home.

items.title: Mother issues urgent appeal as WA Police call off search for missing son, Zjaequaan Sebasio
items.summary: Zjaequaan Sebasio's family and WA Police are urging anyone with information about his location to come forward, after his disappearance almost a week ago.

items.title: Doberman pinscher named Penny wins top prize at Westminster Dog Show
items.summary: Penny bested six other finalists at New York's Madison Square Garden to win the show dog world's most coveted prize, after more than 2,500 dogs strutted their stuff.

items.title: Banned tennis player Thomas Fancutt makes comeback after IV vitamin breach
items.summary: Thomas Fancutt has made his return to professional tennis after receiving a 10-month ban for a vitamin and magnesium infusion.

items.title: Northern Territory mum wrangles Humpty Doo crocodile near Arnhem Highway
items.summary: Melody Wehipeihana was dropping her kids off at school when she pulled over to see what a crowd had gathered to look at in a puddle outside a Northern Territory pub.
